document.docAuthor: Schmidt, C. A. & Shattuck, S. O.
document.masterDocTitle: The Higher Classification of the Ant Subfamily Ponerinae (Hymenoptera: Formicidae), with a Review of Ponerine Ecology and Behavior

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Higher Classification of the Ant Subfamily Ponerinae (Hymenoptera: Formicidae), with a Review of Ponerine Ecology and Behavior

subSubSection.paragraph:
Wilson (1958b) gives a key to Melanesian
Leptogenys species
,
Bolton (1975a)
provides keys to the African and Malagasy
Leptogenys species
, Xu (2000) gives a key to Chinese
Leptogenys species
, and Lattke (2011) has revised the New World taxa.

L. antillana Wheeler, W.M. & Mann, 1914
: Haiti

L. diminuta fruhstorferi Emery, 1896
: Indonesia ( Java )

L. diminuta nongnongi Karavaiev, 1925
: Indonesia ( Java )

L. diminuta opacinodis ( Emery, 1887 )
: Indonesia ( Sumatra )

L. diminuta sarasinorum Forel, 1900
: Sri Lanka

L. diminuta tjibodana Karavaiev, 1926
: Indonesia ( Java )

L. josephi MacKay & MacKay, 2004
: Costa Rica

L. kraepelini esae Forel, 1912
: Indonesia ( Java )

L. kraepelini nero Forel, 1913
: Indonesia ( Java )

L. laeviterga Zhou et al. , 2012
, China

L. manni Wheeler, W.M., 1923
: United States

L. rufida Zhou et al. , 2012
, China
